oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: CMA backstage interviews - Ralph Emery - 1978-10-09 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of Ralph Emery conducting interviews with various artists backstage after the Country Music Award's on October 7, 1978 for radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Ralph Emery talks and congratulates Emmylou Harris on her performance-- Emmylou Harris talks about how she used to be a waitress in Nashville, her album with Dolly Parton, and Linda Ronstadts whereabouts -- Ralph Emery describes the backstage atmosphere and congratulates Don Williams on winning Male Vocalist of The Year -- Joy Williams talks about how proud she is -- Don Williams talks about his two sons Gary and Timmy -- Larry Gatlin talks about and congratulates Don Williams winning Male Vocalist of the Year -- Ralph Emery says that he thinks Gatlin's year is coming -- Larry Gatlin talks about Don Williams work ethic -- Don Williams talks about the speech he gave -- Ralph Emery congratulates Don Williams one last time -- [Unidentified] talks -- Dottie West congratulates Don Williams -- Ralph Emery remarks on West's award and where Kenny Rogers is -- Dottie West says how excited she is and that she will find a good place for the award in her home -- Ralph Emery reminds West that in January of the same here she taped a show with him and she talked about the forthcoming career she would have with Rogers -- Kenny Rogers talks about how excited he was, Dottie and his released singles, and how surprised he was -- Ralph Emery asks how Dottie is to sing with -- Kenny Rogers describes their workflow in the studio -- Dottie West talks about their collaboration -- Ralph Emery talks about Rogers marriage and congratulates them -- Kenny Rogers talks about his book "Making It With Music" -- Ralph Emery describes the Grand Ole Opry Stage and talks about Ronnie Milsap winning Album of the Year -- Ronnie Milsap talks about winning Album of the Year 3 out of the last 4 years and his respect for Emery -- Ralph Emery talks about Milsap's album -- Ronnie Milsap plugs his production team -- Ralph Emery asks when Milsap and he would do a live album again -- Don Reeves talks -- Ronnie Milsap talks about where he keeps his awards -- Ralph Emery congratulates Milsap again -- Ralph Emery talks about Roger's book-- Ken Levitan talks about Roger's book -- Ralph Emery describes the Grand Ole Opry stage and talks about Grandpa Jones Hall of Fame induction -- Grandpa Jones talks about being inducted into the Hall of Fame and how long he has been in the business, and how he got the name Grandpa from Bradley Kincaid -- Ralph Emery congratulates Grandpa Jones again -- Ralph Emery talks about Dolly Parton winning Entertainer of the Year -- Bill Gatzimos talks -- Crystal Gayle talks about winning Female Vocalist of the Year and talks about learning Japanese and traveling to Japan to perform -- Ralph Emery asks about Gayle's wardobe -- Crystal Gayle talks about her new album "When I Dream" -- Ralph Emery describes the Grand Ole Opry stage -- Dolly Parton talks about her dress -- Ralph Emery congratulates Parton on winning Entertainment of the Year -- Dolly Parton talks about winning the award -- Ralph Emery talks about having her on his show early in her career -- Dolly Parton thanks Emery for support early on -- Dolly Parton talks about her movie career, her band leader, and her husband -- Ralph Emery congratulates Parton again -- Sheb Wooly talks -- Ralph Emery talks about looking for the Oak Ridge Boys -- William Lee Golden talks about being an Oak Ridge Boy for 14 years and the groups various members and history -- Richard Sterban talks about how Bonsall accepted their award for Vocal Group of the Year in hopes to stand next to the Statler brothers and their past year as a group -- Ralph Emery talks about the history of the competition for Vocal Group awards -- Richard Sterban talks about how the competition will only increase -- Joe Bonsall talks about he remarks he made when accepting the group's award in regards to standing next to the Statler Brothers and how he could remember Emery talking to the Statler Brothers a previous year after they had won the award -- Ralph Emery talks about the Oak Ridge Boy's image as being both Gospel and Country artists -- Joe Bonsall talks about their Gospel careers and expanding into Country -- Duane Allen talks about the Oak Ridge Boys back up band and their winning of Instrumentalist Group of the Year -- Ralph Emery congratulates the Oak Ridge Boys again and recaps all the award winners -- Roy Clark talks about when he went to Chamberlin high school in Washington D.C. -- Ralph Emery congratulates Clark on winning Instrumentalist of the Year -- Roy Clark tells a story about being fired by Jimmy Dean -- Ralph Emery congratulates Clark again, recaps the award winners, and signs off -- Eight More Miles To Louisville (Grandpa Jones) (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Country Music Association (U.S)--Awards; Emery, Ralph; Harris, Emmylou, 1947-; Williams, Don, 1939-; Williams, Joy; Gatlin, Larry, 1948-; West, Dottie, 1932-1991; Rogers, Kenny; Milsap, Ronnie, 1943-; Reeves, Don; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Gayle, Crystal, 1951-; Parton, Dolly, 1946-; Wooley, Sheb, 1921-2003; Golden, William Lee; Sterban, Richard, 1943-; Bonsall, Joseph S.; Allen, Duane, 1943-; Clark, Roy, 1933-;
